channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 20 Years in, This OG YouTube Channel Is Opening a New Studio
item.description: A new office will support the growth the channel has seen since its founders returned to the helm in 2023.

item.title: 3 Tips From the Leaders of Inc.’s Best in Business Awards
item.description: From tech unicorns to scrappy startups, the leaders named to Inc.’s Best In Business list know how to innovate. Here’s their advice.

item.title: Why Doing the Same Things Well Builds Big Businesses
item.description: Most entrepreneurs crave excitement. The best ones crave consistency. The real magic happens when you master the mundane.

item.title: Musk’s SpaceX discusses record valuation, IPO as soon as 2026
item.description: The transaction would value Elon Musk’s startup at a valuation higher than OpenAI’s record-setting $500 billion, people familiar with the matter said.

item.title: Market segmentation, AI and everything in between
item.description: When it comes to market segmentation, I don’t see truly well-documented cases often. At a more simplistic level, we think of classic matrices such as ...

item.title: There’s One Big Exception to the IRS’ New ‘No Tax on Tips,’ and Enforcement Could Get Awkward
item.description: The debate reignites an age-old question about the definition of obscenity.

item.title: The rise of AI reasoning models comes with a big energy tradeoff
item.description: AI reasoning models used 30 times more power on average to respond to 1,000 written prompts than alternatives without it, a new study finds.

item.title: Hollywood writers say Warner takeover ‘must be blocked’
item.description: “The world’s largest streaming company swallowing one of its biggest competitors is what antitrust laws were designed to prevent,” the WGA said.

item.title: U.S. consumers are so financially strained they put more than $1 billion on buy-now, pay later services during Black Friday and Cyber Monday
item.description: BNPL made up for more than 7.2% of total online sales on Cyber Monday.

item.title: Frank Gehry, world-renowned architect, dies at 96
item.description: Frank Gehry , who designed some of the most imaginative buildings ever constructed and achieved a level of worldwide acclaim seldom afforded any archi...

item.title: Moody’s Home Price Forecast for More Than 300 Housing Markets Through 2035
item.description: ‘Affordability has to be restored for housing to regain its mojo,’ chief economist Mark Zandi told ResiClub.

item.title: CDC panel overturns 1991 newborn vaccine policy, triggering warnings of a public health backslide
item.description: A powerful advisory group within the CDC voted Friday to overturn a longstanding precaution designed to protect newborn babies. If the change is appro...

item.title: It’s ‘kind of jarring’: AI labs like Meta, Deepseek, and Xai earned some of the worst grades possible on an existential safety index
item.description: Anthropic, OpenAI, and Google DeepMind took the top three spots with an overall grade of C+ or C.

item.title: Science says these Christmas songs tank productivity at work
item.description: It’s the first week of December. If you don’t already have the Christmas tunes blasting in the office, what are you waiting for? The debate over liste...

item.title: The CEO of Chief on how the business world can better support women executives
item.description: A recent New York Times headline—“Did Women Ruin the Workplace?”—sparked a firestorm across social media. Alison Moore, CEO of Chief, the prestigious ...
